title: Make it easier to do source builds of gazebo / drcsim

content.raw:
In addition to simulator and simulator-prerelease, I would propose a configuration called simulator-sourcebuild. Several of us are currently doing this manually; here are the steps I follow after I ssh in to a launched simulator machine:

Desired parameters:

* GAZEBO_BRANCH (eg. default, gazebo_1.5)
* GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
* DRCSIM_BRANCH (eg. default, drcsim_2.1)
* DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS (eg. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release)
~~~
sudo apt-get install -y mercurial libprotoc-dev libtar-dev libbullet-dev
# Gazebo
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo -u  ${GAZEBO_BRANCH}
cd gazebo
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/opt/ros/fuerte ${GAZEBO_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
make -j 4
sudo make install
# Drcsim
hg clone https://bitbucket.org/osrf/drcsim -u  ${DRCSIM_BRANCH}
cd ~/drcsim
mkdir build
cd build
cmake .. ${DRCSIM_CMAKE_OPTIONS}
# Then need to set up .bashrc
~~~

Also, the ~/.gazebo/diagnostics directory fills up pretty fast. A trick to avoid that is:
~~~
sudo mkdir /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
sudo chown ubuntu:ubuntu /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics
mkdir ~/.gazebo
ln -s /mnt/gazebo-diagnostics ~/.gazebo/diagnostics
~~~
